questiontext.text:
Which of the following functions are invertible?

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

(This question is to test auto-generated images appear in MCQ options.)

generalfeedback.text: A function is invertible if and only if it takes each value in its range precisely once.  The functions that are not invertible here are not invertible because they take some values more than once.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text: You have correctly identified one of the correct answers, but missed \({@setdifference(setify(corr1),setify(ans1))@}\).

questiontext.text:
Which method would you use to find \(\int\sin(x)\cos(x)\mathrm{d} x\)?

[[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]]

(The purpose of this question is to test the "teacher's answer" display is the string shown, not the value returned to Maxima).

generalfeedback.text: Indeed, all four methods can be readily used on this integration problem!

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.
